To the contrary, she says that she likes to feel useful while she generates income that in the future will allow her to enjoy her old age with more peace of mind and with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart, cooking utensils, (spoons, knives, plastic containers, a propane gas pipette, and more) as well as ingredients wholesale (bread, cold cuts, sauces, sodas, cheese, and more). In addition she wants to make improvements in the space for the parking lot for which she needs cement and adobe bricks.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena es una joven de 25 años de edad, emprendedora y profesional de administración de empresas turísticas, luego de culminar sus estudios universitarios estuvo empleada por 2 años, pero luego de un tiempo la empresa donde trabajaba prescindió de sus servicios, razón que la impulsó a buscar nuevas alternativas para generar recursos económicos que le permitieran apoyar a su madre con el sustento del hogar; tuvo la idea de producir artículos para regalos personalizados como estuches para celular y para agendas, delantales para cocina, maletines, entre otros, comenzó a confeccionarlos y a ofrecerlos por internet y hoy en día, con 8 meses de funcionamiento de su negocio, sus clientes le realizan los pedidos por correo electrónico o vía telefónica, ya que cada detalle es personalizado según el gusto de sus clientes. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la creación de una página web, comprar una máquina plana industrial, sacar material publicitario y comprar insumos al por mayor (tela, hilos, lona, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con la dinámica de su labor y podrá optimizar el tiempo de producción con la nueva máquina, pues la que posee no le da el rendimiento necesario, además podrá tener una página web en la que podrá exhibir sus productos y facilitar el contacto con sus clientes, logrando así, mejorar las ventas y los ingresos que percibe con este arte. Todo esto le permitirá a Lorena seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas para un futuro, pues a corto plazo desea abrir mercado en otras ciudades, a mediano plazo sueña con abrir un almacén en un local comercial y a largo plazo tiene la idea de exportar sus artículos, por ello manifiesta su interés en seguir luchando incansablemente, con disciplina y dedicación porque de ello depende su futuro económico y el bienestar para su familia.
texts.en: Lorena is a 25 year old woman who is enterprising and a manager of tourism businesses. After finishing college, she was employed for 2 years, but after a time the business where she worked no longer needed her services and this drover her to look for alternatives to generate income that would allow her to help her mother supporting the home. She had the idea of producing personalized gift items such as cell phone and datebook cases, aprons, briefcases, and more. She started to make them and offer them on the internet. Today, after 8 months in business, her customers order via email or on the telephone, since each detail is personalized according to her customers' tastes. Right now, she is asking for the help of a loan to invest in creating a web page, buying an industrial planer, and buying materials wholesale (fabric, thread, canvas, and more). This will allow her to continue with her work dynamic and she will be able to optimize the production time with the new machine. The one she has doesn't give her the performance she needs. In addition, she will be able to have a website where she can exhibit her products and facilitate contact with her customer, thus improving her sales and the income she gets from this art. All of this will allow Lorena to keep advancing towards achieving her goals for the future. In the short term, she wants to open the market in other cities. In the medium term, she dreams of opening a store in a commercial location, and in the long term, she has the idea of exporting her items, To do this she expresses her interest in continuing to fight tirelessly with discipline and dedication because her financial future and the well being of her family depend on it.

loans.use: to invest in creating a webpage, to buy an industrial planer machine, to take out ads and to buy materials wholesale (fabric, thread, canvas, and more).

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, no pudo seguir estudiando debido a los escasos recurso de su familia. Esta acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la albañilería, sus hijos viven con ella y dos ya van a la escuela y solamente sus tres hijos dependen de ella. 

Carmen es una persona humilde, responsable que tiene un pequeño negocio de pupusas y tiene 9 años de dedicarse a lo mismo. Empezó con una tía y la tía le enseño el oficio, después ella se acompaño y su esposo le consiguio un puesto en el tiangue municipal y desde entonces ella todos los martes vende pupusas. Los demás días de la semana  trabaja en un taller de ropa deportiva. De su casa para donde tiene el puesto de pupusas le queda como a tres cuadras y del taller de ropa le queda como a 7 cuadras desde su casa. El día martes que es el día que ella hace las pupusas empieza desde la 5 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde y en el trabajo desde la 8 hasta las 4 de la tarde.

El préstamo sera invertido, para comprar mas mercadería y hacer mas fuerte el negocio de pupusas y ropa. Así se le estará dando la oportunidad de instalar una tienda en la casa y así aumentara mas los ingresos para su familia, y a la vez, que ahorre para  los estudios del próximo año de sus tres hijos.

El sueño de Carmen, es que sus hijos estudien y lleguen a ser profesionales, en alguna carrera universitaria y tengan un mejor futuro que ella.
texts.en:
Carmen, who is 34 years old, went to school through the ninth grade. She was not able to continue in school due to the limited resources of her family. She has a partner, who works in masonry. Their children live with her, and two already go to school. Only her three children depend on her.

Carmen is a humble, responsible person who has had a little pupusa business for nine years. She began with an aunt, and the aunt taught her the work. Later she married and her husband got her a stand in the little municipal market, and since then she has been selling pupusas every Tuesday. The other days of the week she works in a workshop for sports clothing. From her house to her pupusa stand is about three blocks, and from the clothing workshop to her home is about 7 blocks. On Tuesdays, which is the day when she makes pupusas, she begins at 5 in the morning [and works] until 4 in the afternoon, and in her work, from 8 to 4 in the afternoon.

The loan will be invested in buying more merchandise and strengthening her pupusa and clothing businesses. Thus it will be giving her the opportunity to set up a shop in her house and thus increase her family's income even more, and at the same time she can save for her three children's school expenses for next year.

Carmen's dream is that her children go to school for some university course and become professionals, and have a better future than she does.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and strengthen her pupusa and clothing businesses

loans.name: Myya

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Myya from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. She started her business because she wants to support herself and her children. For the past 10 years, Myya has established her cosmetics business. She works for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of a permanent business location.

Myya requires a loan in order to purchase more items such as purses, earrings, chains, and bracelets. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and sustain her family. In the future, Myya plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as purses, earrings, chains, and bracelets.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Zainab from the Waterloo Eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 3 children. She was a housewife; she started this business to contribute to taking care of her children. 

Zainab runs a food stand business at home; she sells rice, cooking oil, and seasoning. She has been running this business since 2008. She works throughout the week, from morning to night. Zainab says that her business is doing well because she is able to take care of her family with the profit.

Zainab has requested a loan in order to buy more items such as rice, cooking oil, and seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, cooking oil, and seasoning.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bulk of meat to resell in her butcher shop business.

Esperanza has been in this business for 15 years. Esperanza earns more income from raising cattle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Esperanza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bulk of meat to resell.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Memunatu from the Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. For the past 10 years, Memunatu has established her slippers business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Menunatu requires a loan in order to buy more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay for her children's school fees. In the future, Memunatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando has been an industrious farmer for fifteen years. He needs additional capital to purchase farm inputs like rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to sustain the nutrients needed for his crop to grow as he wished for. He is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase the farm inputs needed. 

He manages his time cautiously to take good care of his agriculture businesses. He hopes to continue working to succeed at his endeavors in order to have a better life someday.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine and a variety of cloths for her new business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 48 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emily has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Emily is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: Geronima tiene 54 años es soltera con un nieto al cual apoya económicamente. Pertenecer al grupo “ESFUERZO DE MUJERES” le ha permitido iniciar su negocio de venta de comidas al cual se dedicada hace un años y medio. Años atrás se dedicaba al servicio domestico. Y en la etapa de su juventud se dedicaba a la venta de hierbas naturales carnes y queso. El préstamo lo invertira en la compra de ollas más grandes y vajillas nuevas. El grupo agradece a los inversionsitas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Geronima es la primera persona parada del lado derecho viste chompa ploma.
texts.en: Geronima is 54 years old, single, and has a grandson whom she supports.  She is a member of the ESFUERZO DE MUJERES group and it allowed her to start a business selling food a year and a half ago.  Years ago she worked as a domestic employee.  When she was younger she sold natural herbs, meats, and cheeses.  She will use the money from this loan to buy large pots and new dishes.  This group is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Geronima is the first person to the right, with her sweater wrapped around her.

loans.use: to buy pots and dishes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who farms and runs a retail shop, used her previous loan to pay school fees for her child who is in secondary school. 

She plans to use this loan to buy feed for her cattle and goods to sell in her retail shop. These include sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and soap. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and add to her savings.

Her hopes for the future are to be financially stable and educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed and purchase stock for her shop.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has a business selling fruits and vegetables in Oloitoktok town and has been running it for three years now. She makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is 51 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with six children.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of fruits such as bananas, oranges and mangoes as well as vegetables to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family. 

This is her first loan and in the future, she hopes to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married with three children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Selina operates a business selling scrap metals. She cites price fluctuation as her major challenge.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase more stock of metallic scrap parts for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more metallic scrap parts for resale

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 28 years old and runs a butchery business. He is married and together with his spouse who as a salon business, they have been blessed with one child.  Augustine has been in this business for two years and it has been profitable. He makes a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings. 

Augustine will use this loan to buy more stock of meat to sell. This is his first loan term and in the future, he hopes to own more business assets.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat to sell.

loans.name: Gawdensia

texts.en:
Gawdensia is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as an experienced person. She operates a clothing store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable place.
 
She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes.
 
Her business goal is to have a sustainable business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mwanamwaka

texts.en:
Mwanamwaka has been operating a food vending business, but she is aggressive and now wishes to continue expanding her business. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she is appreciative of the opportunity from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Marsel

texts.en: Marsel is a young farmer from Dalarik village in the Armavir region. He lives with his parents. To take care of his family, Marsel is extensively engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, and the cultivation of wheat, alfalfa, peaches and apricots. With the help of his family members, he realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Marsel works really hard to be able to meet the ends (make ends meet). He is the main breadwinner of the family. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Marsel needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support to this young, hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizers, and three steers, and to pay for harvesting services. Marsel and his parents rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizers, and steers and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Félix Ramón

texts.es: Félix es un joven campesino de 23 años de edad, que desde muy pequeño aprendió a realizar las labores del campo gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres quienes han sido agricultores y jornaleros durante su vida. Hoy en día posee su propio cultivo de yuca, cuya cosecha es recolectada y vendida en el mercado de la región, adicionalmente y, para complementar sus ingresos, realiza trabajos como jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región. Su empuje, tenacidad y dinamismo lo llevan a buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, entre otros), que son necesarios para preparar la tierra y así poder sacar una cosecha mucho más productiva, que le permita vender a mejor precio y así aumentar el margen de utilidades. Félix solo desea darle continuidad a su actividad generadora de recursos, pues es feliz haciendo su labor y, en un futuro desea ampliar sus cultivos para generar oportunidades de empleo que le permitan mejorar no sólo su calidad de vida, sino también la de otros vecinos del sector.
texts.en: Félix is a young farmer of 23 who learned to do farm work when he was very young, thanks to the teachings of his parents, who have been farmers and day laborers throughout their lives. Now he has his own planting of yucca, whose harvest is collected and sold in the regional market. In addition, and to complement his income, he does work as a day laborer on different farms in the region. His drive, tenacity, and dynamism lead him to look for new alternatives that will allow him to advance. For this reason, he is applying for the support of the loan, with which he wants to buy wholesale agricultural supplies (compost, pesticides, and fertilizers, among other items), which are necessary to prepare the land and thus get a much more productive harvest, which will allow him to sell at a better price and thus increase his profit margin. Félix only wants to continue this income-generating activity, because he is happy doing his work, and in the future he wants to expand his plantings to generate employment opportunities that will allow him to improve not only his quality of life, but also that of other neighbors in the area.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies wholesale (compost, pesticides, and fertilizers, among other items)

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Ramon's age is 57. He has been growing rice for twenty seven years. He has two hectares of land where he grows his products. He needs a loan of PHP 20,000 in order to buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and pay for the co-farmers. By providing these farm necessities, Ramon will be able to yield higher crops and provide the needs of his family and agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and pay for the co-farmers.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmaa is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a Ger (a traditional nomadic yurt) in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. Her husband, Ganbaatar, is 43 and herds livestock. Her older two children help their parents and herd their livestock. Her youngest son is in a public primary school.
 
Bayarmaa started her organic dairy products production and sales business in 2004. She has created her own reputation from scratch, and now she is well-known among clients with her qualified products and services. She is now requesting loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of dairy products from herders in countryside to resell at her counter. Lunar new year and the new year are the best seasons for her sales. She is hardworking, diligent, and neat woman who says: "My business has been expanding little by little since I started it".

loans.use: to purchase large amount of dairy products from herders in the countryside to resell at her counter.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 28 years old and has three children. Evelyn is married and two of her children are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural pig fattening business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Evelyn has been pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 49 years old and married with five children.

Francisca works hard to provide for her family. She runs charcoal vending in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

Francisca has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal vending for 20 years, and earns an income from fish vending.

Francisca aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura is 40 years old and has four children. Rosaura is married and two of her children are still in school.

Rosaura is in the pig fattening agricultural business in the Philippines. Rosaura requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds, and vitamins for her business.

Rosaura has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosaura would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edna is 32 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Edna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients, such as pork, chicken, liver, seasonings, etc. for her food vending business.

Edna has been in this business for two years. Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as pork, chicken, liver, seasonings, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Karen Yamile

texts.es:
Ella es karen yamile, pasa a tercer semestre de auxiliar de enfermería en campo alto, ella pertenecía al programa de gestores de crecimiento y ya se quito este convenio con los estudiantes, las cuotas quedan muy altas para continuar estudiando, por esta razón quiso tramitar con kiva, ya que la situación económica de la familia no esta en las mejores condiciones.  
Aparte de eso no quiere dejar el estudio a mitad, ya que cuando ella se gradué de once, se gradúa de una vez de enfermería y los descuentos de kiva serán de gran ayuda para continuar con los proyectos y propósitos.
Otra de las opciones que quiere tomar, fue integrarse a un contrato de aprendizaje, pero para eso tiene que tener disponibilidad de tiempo completo y no les es posible, ya que la jornada en el colegio es de 7 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde y consulto con el papa y el le dijo que buscara otra  opción, a si que resibio información sobre el programa con kiva y desidio que con este le queda un poco mas factible seguir con la carrera comenzando a formar una mejor calidad de vida para ella y la familia.
Agradece que saliera favorecida con kiva, como forma de ayuda en los estudios.
texts.en:
This is Karen Yamile, who is in her third semester as a nursing assistant student at CampoAlto. 

She had been in the Growth Management program, but an agreement with the students was cancelled and this program is no longer available. The costs to continue studying are very high, and for this reason she wanted to apply to Kiva, as her family’s economic situation is not good.  

Also, she does not want to drop out of school halfway through, as when she graduates, she will be a nurse, and a Kiva loan will help her very much to continue pursuing her plans and goals.

She would also like to enter into a learning contract, but this is not possible because it requires her to be available full-time, as the school day is from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m., and her father has told her to look for another alternative.

She found out about the Kiva program and she decided that with Kiva´s help, it would be possible to continue working toward her degree, and begin to make a better quality of life for her and her family.

She is thankful to Kiva for helping her with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is 37 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the region of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Salim has been working hard to manage his spare parts business in which he sells car and motorcycle spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Salim has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tires, oil, tubes and rubbers, and will help Salim to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Salim hopes that in the future, he will be able to have a bigger business. 

Salim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Salim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

"

loans.use: to buy more tires, oil, tubes, and rubbers

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es: Griselda se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes,  perfumes, cremas, shampoo, entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia,  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra sacar adelante su hogar, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 18 y 21 años de edad, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, cremas, shampoo, etc. ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a sus hijos lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Griselda sells all types of personal use products, such as lotions, deodorants, perfumes, creams, shampoo, and other things.  Her business is located in her home and she is able to get the household ahead with her earnings.  She is a single mother who lives in a home of her own and has two children, ages 18 and 21.  She wants to grow her business and is asking for a loan to buy perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, creams, shampoo, etc. since she has many customers because she sells her products for good prices.  This assistance will allow her to obtain better earnings and continue to provide for her children without limits.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Eladio's Group

texts.en:
Eladio, María del Carmen, and Bernabé live in the community of "Adolfo Lopez Mateos" located in one of the poorest areas of the state of Campeche.  They work in the fields that surround their homes by removing undergrowth from the land.  

Eladio learned to work the land when he was very young.  He is able to save some of his income from his farming to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to replace the use of hazardous lighting sources.  He chose to invest some of his income in this solar home system so he can light his home at night.  With this light, Eladio and his family will be able to do their chores and homework at ay time in the day and night.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will replace the use of diesel lamps

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will replace the use of diesel lamps and candles

loans.name: Aghavni

texts.en: Aghavni is an experienced farmer from Dalarik village of the Armavir region of Armenia. She lives with her husband and three school aged children (a 16-year-old son and two daughters - 15 and 12 years old). Aghavni's husband is a craftsman in the private sector.  He is the main breadwinner of the family and works hard to be able to make ends meet. To help her husband in earning a living for the family, Aghavni is engaged in cattle breeding, agriculture, and in the cultivation of sunflowers, grass, and grapes. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. To sustain her agribusiness, Aghavni needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase a cow and some forage (grass and barley). She had previously taken a loan from a local financial institution but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Aghavni is now able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Aghavni and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and some forage (grass and barley).

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with 10 children. She describes herself as a person who has a lot of faith. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area. 
She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to have a retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy additional stock of charcoal

loans.name: Poly

texts.en:
Poly, 41 years old, is from the small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Harekrishna, who is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and two sons in their own Pacca house (concrete made). Poly is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband completed a Higher Secondary education (Grade 12). Their two sons are also students. One of them reads in Class VIII (Grade 8) and other is in Class I (Grade 1).

Poly's husband is engaged in agricultural work. He has been associated with agricultural activities for many years. He produces beans, onions and other vegetables for the family's consumption and to sell in the local market. Poly is a housewife. She manages the household works and, at the same time, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Poly's husband's earnings are hardly enough to cover food and household costs for the family. Poly decided to grow potatoes on their land and sell them to the local bazaar, since potatoes are in demand in the present market. She hopes she will be able to increase the family funds through potato cultivation.
 
As soon as she heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner), she applied for a loan to help her husband to buy good quality potato seeds and fertilizers. 

Her plan is to make her business run smoothly and give a good future to her children. She also wants to buy a plot of land with the profit from her business.

She is thankful for BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 47 years old, married to Jane and blessed with three children. He has a taxi business, which he has been doing for six years now. He makes a monthly income of KES 45,000. 

He plans to use the loan to buy chicks and chicken feed since he wants to start a poultry selling business. This will enable him to supply chicken and eggs to hotels and other markets. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and do other developments. 

This is his third loan. He paid his previous loans successfully. He hopes to provide the best education to his children and ensure they have good shelter.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 40 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a sanitation worker for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $10 daily. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Mom is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run a food store at home and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she wants rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a pigs-raising business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, and other supplies for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luz is 33 years old and three of her children are still in school.

Luz has a food vending business in the Philippines. Luz requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients, such as flour, coconuts, sugar, etc. for her business.

Luz has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Luz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, such as flour, coconuts, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 40 years old and has four children. Estrella is married and all of her children are in school.

Estrella is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrella has been raising pigs for fourteen years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 49 years old and married with seven children. With four children currently in school, Ignacia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stock like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, and noodles to sell.

Ignacia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, and noodles.

In the future, Ignacia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en:
Afuwa is 36 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa, Uganda. She is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past six years, Afuwa has been working hard to manage her clothing business and sell clothes. 

To help expand her business, Afuwa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more gomesi, shirts, skirts, and other materials and will help Afuwa to generate greater profits and increase stock. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a big shop. 

Afuwa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Afuwa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more gomesi, shirts, skirts, and other materials.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 22-year-old single man who has been working as a supervisor in an agricultural maintenance business for four months. This is his only source of income. Hamza is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing himself. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for his university educational fees since his low income isn't enough to cover the increasing tuition fees. This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan was invested in paying for both his driving license fees and his university tuition fees. 

He is an optimistic person who believes when there is a will, there is a way, and he is sure that when he finishes his education, he will face the brighter future that he seeks.

He hopes to keep on developing himself and is looking forward for his graduation when he can take the official career path for which he aims.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fees

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Ines; ella es conviviente y tiene 56 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara diferentes platos de comida como pollo al horno, estofado de carne y sopas,  y el negocio de venta de comida lo realiza en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras al por mayor.
La socia que levanta la mano es la socia Julia.

La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de artesanía, negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the SEÑOR DE PUQUIN communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.

Ines is 56 years old, lives with her husband, and has five children.  She has a food business and prepares different dishes, such as roast chicken, meat stew, and soups.  She sells on foot and gets her children ahead through this business.  She wants to expand and improve her food business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, meat, and vegetables in quantity.

Julia is the one with her hand raised.

The member whose picture is attached was not able to attend the meeting due to work commitments.  The other members are artists, weavers, restaurant owners, food vendors, and sell beauty products.  [Julia] is grateful to those who form part of this dream and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: This is Lucy. She previously accessed a loan, that she used to buy more stock in her kiosk shop. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs and sweets for resale.   for her business.She appreciates Kiva for their financial support..

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is a young agronomist from Nshavan of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, two-year-old daughter, and two brothers-in-law. To take care of their needs, Ani and her family members are extensively engaged in agribusiness. They are involved in cattle and pig breeding and in the cultivation of wheat, apricots, peaches, and grapes.  They sell the agricultural products at the local market which is the main source of the family’s income. 

To continue running the agribusiness in a sustainable way, Ani needs to make some investments. A loan of $3000 will greatly help her and her family by enabling them to renovate the barn, to purchase forage for cattle, and to renovate the agricultural machinery. The loan will help the family organize and run their agribusiness in a more productive and efficient way. 

As this is Ani’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Ani and her large family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support.

loans.use: to renovate the barn, to purchase forage for cattle, and to renovate the agricultural machinery

loans.name: Varazdat

texts.en:
Varazdat is an experienced farmer from Eghegnut village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife, son and daughter. To take care of his family’s needs Varazdat is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding a livestock of sheep, and in cultivation of tomato, eggplant, and grapes. With the help of his son he sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family.

As the life is getting more expensive on a day-to-day basis, Varazdat wants to expand his agribusiness a little, to be able to more effectively meet his family daily needs. A loan of USD 2000 will help him reach his goal enabling him to purchase three steers, and to buy some forage (grass and barley) for the livestock. Varazdat and his family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three steers, and to buy some forage (grass and barley) for the livestock

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking  oil.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Lernagog village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife, 7-year-old daughter and 5-year-old son. Artur is employed in the private sector and is the main breadwinner of the family. His salary, however, is not enough to fully cover the increasing needs of his family. Artur is also engaged in cattle breeding. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of income for his family.

As the family’s needs are increasing with time, Artur wants to expand his agribusiness to be able to more effectively cover the daily expenses of his family. He needs a loan of USD 2500 to purchase two cows and four steers. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Artur was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Artur and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and four steers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will enable his family to perform home activities more safely

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en:
Lusik is an experienced farmer from Aygestan village of the Ararat region of Armenia. She lives with her husband and two sons. She has been engaged in agribusiness for more than 10 years. With the help of her family members, Lusik breeds pigs and cultivates tomatoes, peaches, apricots, and grapes. Her husband and sons help her sell the agricultural products in the local market which is the main source of the family’s income. 

Lusik’s agribusiness currently needs some investments in order for it to function in a sustainable way and be productive. A loan of $2500 would greatly support this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to renovate the greenhouse, to purchase two calves, and to buy forage for the cattle. 

Lusik and her family members highly rely on the good will of the lenders and greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the greenhouse, to purchase two calves, and to buy forage for the cattle.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa es una joven emprendedora de 23 años de edad que ha tenido que enfrentarse a diversos desafíos primero por ser madre a tan temprana edad, pues tiene un hijo de 5 años al que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo.
Desde hace algún tiempo, comenzó a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo mercancía que su madre le enviaba desde el extranjero y además ofrecía productos por catálogo; esta idea surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos económicos para apoyar a su esposo con el sustento del hogar.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su actividad generadora de recursos, Luisa solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (ropa, calzado, perfumería, cremas corporales, entre otros), esto le permitirá capitalizar más su negocio y podrá ofrecer una mayor variedad de artículos que satisfagan los gustos de su clientela, además podrá brindar la opción de pago a plazos para que sus ventas se incrementen y pueda atraer nuevos compradores. 
De esta forma es como Luisa desea seguir avanzando para llegar a cumplir el sueño de tener su propio almacén de ropa, calzado y accesorios, que esté bien ubicado en una zona comercial, para que le garantice una rentabilidad favorable y le permita disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar con los que ama.
texts.en:
Luisa is an entrepreneurial young woman. She is 23 years old and has encountered a variety of obstacles, such as becoming a mother at such a young age. She has a 5 year old son, whom she has cared for through great effort.

For some time now she has worked as an independent saleswoman, selling merchandise which her mother sends to her from abroad. She also sells catalog items. This idea grew out of her need to generate income to support her husband in sustaining their household.

Motivated to strengthen her business, Luisa requests the support of a loan to purchase merchandise (clothing, shoes, perfume, lotion, etc.) from wholesalers. This will enable her to increase her business capital and to offer a greater variety of items to satisfy the tastes of her customers. She will also be able to grow her sales and attract new buyers by offering the option of paying in installments.

In this way, Luisa hopes to continue advancing and to achieve her dream of owning her own shop selling clothing, shoes and accessories. It will be well located in a commercial center in order to guarantee good profitability and in order to permit Luisa to enjoy a better quality of life and well-being with her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk such as clothing, shoes, perfume and lotion.

loans.name: Ahixa Arely

texts.es: Ahixa de 47 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo de 18 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando el bachillerato en el Instituto Público de su localidad. Ahixa se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y dedicada ya que todos los días recorre las principales zonas de su localidad para ofrecer y vender sus productos (ropa nueva para dama y caballero). Muchas personas le demandan cada día más sus prendas de vestir ya que siempre mantiene un inventario variado y correspondiente a las modas de la temporada. Desea construir un cuarto para proteger su cocina la cual tiene al aire libre y esto no es higiénico ni seguro. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para levantar el cuarto de cocina y poder proteger sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en: Ahixa is 47 years old and the single mother of an 18 year old young man who is currently working on a bachelor’s degree at the local public institution.  Ahixa is known for being an enterprising and dedicated woman who travels through all the main areas of her city to offer and sell her products (new men’s and women’s clothing).  Many people want her clothing more each day, since she always maintains an assorted inventory according to the seasonal styles.  She wants to build a room to protect her kitchen, which is currently an open air one and this is not healthy nor safe.  She is asking for this loan, through FUSAI so she can buy bricks, cement, sand, iron bars, and pay for labor to build the room and be able to protect her possessions.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice runs a cafe business, selling food to her neighbors. The previous loan helped her to buy food ingredients to cook. In addition, she wants to start a new business of selling khangas (women's wrap clothing). Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy 30 pairs of khangas for sale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy 30 pairs of khangas (women's wrap clothing) for sale.

loans.name: Beldine

texts.en:
Beldine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a motivated person. She operates a tailoring business, where she makes dresses for sale. 

She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy materials for making dresses, i.e., fabric, threads, etc. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dresses, i.e., fabric, threads, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an experienced farmer from Paruyr Sevak village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and 4-year-old daughter. Aida and her husband have been engaged in agribusiness for more than 10 years. They are involved in cattle breeding, in viniculture and in the cultivation of wheat. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Both of them work really hard to be able to make the ends meet. 

Aida's agribusiness currently needs some investments in order for it to function in an efficient and productive way. A loan of USD $2,500 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase wheat seeds, to buy forage for cattle, and to renovate the barn. Aida and her husband highly rely on the good will of lenders and will be grateful to them for the support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, to buy forage for the cattle, and to renovate the barn.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 40 years old and has six children. She is married and three children are still in school. Rosela is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed two times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to sustain her business.

Rosela requested a 7,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vaccines for her pigs. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Edolina

texts.en:
Edolina is 54 years old and widowed with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edolina has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years.

Edolina requested a 30,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, beads, zippers, etc., for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business. Edolina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, beads, zippers, etc., for her business

loans.name: Gloria Estella

texts.es:
Gloria  es una mujer activa y emprendedora; a sus 52 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio taller de confección, el cual montó luego de haber estudiado diseño de modas; trabajó en una empresa durante 13 años donde aprendió el manejo de las máquinas y perfeccionó sus conocimientos y técnica, lo que la impulsó a desarrollar su habilidad de manera independiente; por ello, desde el año 1998 ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros y, hoy en día cuenta con el apoyo de una hermana y una sobrina que son empleadas directas y de manera indirecta cuenta con otras dos operarias que realizan el acabado y empaque de la producción.
El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas e hilos), con lo que podrá sacar la producción de uniformes escolares y de dotación, además estará en la capacidad de adquirir nuevos contratos para mejorar los ingresos, con los que espera poder alcanzar el sueño de tener su taller en un local comercial, que tenga acceso para vehículos para poder transportar la producción de manera más ágil; logrando fidelizar a los clientes y garantizar la entrada de recursos para mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria at 52 is an active and enterprising woman. She works in her own sewing shop which she started after having studied fashion design. She worked for a company for 13 years where she learned how to use the machines. She perfected her knowledge and technique which made her want to practice her ability on her own.

Since 1998 she has been offering sewing services to third parties. Today she counts on the help of a sister and a niece who work as direct employees. She has two other operators who are not directly employed who do the finishing and packing of the production.

The loan that Gloria is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wholesale supplies (cloth and thread). This will be used to make school and staff uniforms. Gloria will also be in a position to accept new contracts to increase her revenues. She hopes to to be able to attain her dream of having a workshop in a commercial space with access for vehicles to transport the product in a more efficient manner. She wants to gain the loyalty of her customers and guarantee the ingress of resources to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies (cloth and thread) wholesale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married with two children. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, seasonings, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su compañera de vida, su hija y su madre en casa de un familiar, se dedica a trabajar en su molino desde hace 5 años  procesando todo tipo de alimentos como maíz, frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros, posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y muy decidido a luchar por sus sueños, está trabajando muy duro todos los días para no decepcionar a su familia, se siente satisfecho y muy cómodo con su negocio, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cuchillas, discos, lazos, etc. para darle mantenimiento a sus molinos. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica y emocional a su familia.
texts.en: He lives with his wife, daughter, and mother in a family home.  He has a mill and has been processing all types of food such as corn, beans, flours, salsas, and other things for the past five years.  He has lots of experience that helps generate good earnings and he is very well known in the local community.  He has many customers who prefer him because of his prices, good service, and quality.  He is an enterprising man, dedicated to his work and very dedicated to working hard every day to achieve his dreams and so he doesn’t disappoint his family.  He is satisfied and comfortable with his business and his customer demand has increased in the past few weeks.  He is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL so he can buy blades, disks, ties, etc. to maintain his mill.  He has good credit references and is committed to repaying this loan and to bringing financial and emotional security to his family.

loans.use: to buy parts for his mill.

loans.name: Dargida Del Carmen

texts.es: Dargida, a sus 53 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar, pues es la que lleva toda la carga económica de su familia. Actualmente se dedica a fabricar y comercializar productos de aseo como escobas, trapeadoras, jabón líquido y desinfectantes para uso doméstico, actividad que aprendió en un curso de capacitación que realizó sobre manipulación de químicos y elaboración de escobas y traperos. Trabaja sola de lunes a sábado con el fin de poder sacar toda la producción para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan; de esta manera genera los recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. La cliente se caracteriza por ser una persona alegre, carismática y perseverante, siempre está en busca de nuevas alternativas que le ayuden a mejorar su negocio y por ello, ve la oportunidad de un apoyo con el crédito que solicita, con el dinero desea comprar insumos al por mayor (telas en retazos, alambre, glicerina, colágeno, aceites aromáticos, hipoclorito, palos de madera, entre otros), esto le permitirá fortalecer su inventario para poder cumplir a tiempo con los encargos y así lograr vender más cantidad de artículos para incrementar el nivel de ganancias y seguir invirtiendo en su actividad generadora de ingresos. Dargida sueña con montar su negocio en un local comercial más amplio y que esté ubicado en el centro del municipio en el que reside, para darse a conocer en otros sectores y poder ampliar las ventas, lo que le garantizará una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su hijo.
texts.en: Dargida is 53 years old, has a son, is the head of the household, and covers all the household expenses.  She currently makes and sells household products such as brooms, mops, liquid soap, and household disinfectants.  She learned to do this through a course she took on chemical handling and broom and mop making.  She works alone from Monday through Saturday so that she can meet her customer demand and earn enough to meet the basic family needs.  She is known for being a happy, charismatic, and persevering lady, always in search of new ways to help and improve her business.  She sees an opportunity through this loan and she will use the money to buy supplies in quantity (cloth, wire, glycerin, glue, aromatic oils, hypochlorite, wooden poles, and other things) which will allow her to strengthen her inventory so she can complete her orders on time, be able to sell more, increase her profits, and invest into her income generating business.  Dargida dreams of setting her business up in a larger location in the city center, so she can become known in other areas and be able to increase her sales and guarantee her financial stability so she can provide her son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Luz Ángela

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 36 años de edad, es reconocida como una mujer amable y activa; esposa y madre ejemplar de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo.
Hace algunos años comenzó su vida productiva como comerciante independiente, vendiendo frutas, jugos y helados en el garaje de su vivienda, pero debido a la ola de violencia que azotaba el barrio donde vivía, decidió cerrarlo para velar por el bien propio y de su familia.
Hace 3 años comenzó nuevamente a comerciar con mercancía como ropa, perfumería y tenis, aprovechando que es reconocida en el sector y por lo tanto tiene muy buena clientela; lo que le permite generar ingresos para solventar algunos gastos del hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de jeans, perfumería, busos y tenis al por mayor, esto le permitirá aumentar la variedad de artículos para la venta y podrá satisfacer los gustos de su clientela, aumentando así los ingresos para su familia.
Luz manifiesta que su propósito es adquirir un local bien ubicado, en el que pueda exhibir sus productos y atraer nuevos clientes, para aumentar las ventas e ingresos con los que le puede brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y disfrutar mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Luz at 36 years old is known as a friendly and active woman. She is a wife and mother of 3 children who she has gotten ahead through great effort. A few years ago she started her productive life as an independent businessperson selling fruit, juice and ice-cream from the garage of her house. But because of the wave of violence that struck her neighborhood, she decided to close the business and watch out for her family and herself.

Three years ago she started again, selling merchandise like clothing, perfume and running shoes taking advantage of being well-known in her district. So she has a good clientele which allows her to generate the income to pay some of the household expenses.

The loan Luz is requesting will be invested buying jeans, perfume, jerseys and running shoes wholesale. This will allow her to increase the variety of articles she has for sale and satisfy the demands of her customers. She wants to increase the revenues for her family.

Luz explains that her goal is to acquire a well-located space where she can display her product and attract new clients. She'd like to increase her sales and profit so she can offer her children a better education and enjoy a better quality of living along with her family.

loans.use: to buy jeans, perfume, sport jerseys and running shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Luzcenit Del Carmen

texts.es: Luzcenit, a sus 57 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Se dedica a vender mercancía como ropa, calzado, bolsos, entre otros productos, con el fin de generar recursos económicos para apoyar a su esposo con el sustento de la familia; esta actividad la aprendió de su madre, quien también se dedicó por muchos años a realizar esta labor. Hoy en día, sus principales clientes son docentes de colegios aledaños a su vivienda, sus familiares y vecinos del sector; de esta forma ocupa la mayor parte de su tiempo, mientras genera una entrada de dinero para solventar los gastos de su hogar. La cliente se caracteriza por ser una mujer activa, dinámica, pujante y carismática, siempre tiene una actitud positiva frente a la vida y va en busca de nuevas alternativas que le permitan continuar con su labor. Por ello, solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (camisas, blusas, jeans, zapatos, tacones, accesorios, chaquetas, bolsos, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad de artículos disponible para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad y además sus clientes tendrán mejores opciones para escoger según sus diversos gustos y necesidades; esto le permitirá aumentar el nivel de ingresos que obtiene con su labor. Así, Luzcenit manifiesta que puede avanzar para lograr cumplir el sueño de montar su propio almacén, en el que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y trabajar más cómodamente, y con ello, tener una mejor rentabilidad en su negocio, para que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable y le permita disfrutar una vejez más tranquila al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
At 57 years old, Luzcenit is the mother of three children and lives in a common-law marriage with her significant other. She earns her living selling merchandise like clothing, footwear, handbags, and other products, with the objective of generating economic resources to support her spouse in providing for the family. She learned this business from her mother, who also did this work for many years. Today, her main customers are neighborhood schoolteachers, relatives, and neighbors in her area; this occupies the majority of her time and generates an income to pay for household expenses. 

Luzcenit is known to be an active, dynamic, robust, and charismatic woman. She always has a positive attitude toward life and continually looks for new alternatives that allow her to keep working. That's why she is requesting the loan, which she hopes to use to buy assorted items at wholesale (shirts, blouses, jeans, shoes, high-heeled shoes, accessories, jackets, handbags, and more). Then she will have a greater variety of articles available to satisfy the increasing demand during the Christmas season. In addition, her customers will have better options to choose from according to their diverse tastes and needs, allowing her to augment the income she obtains through her work. Luzcenit states that this income will move her closer to her dream of setting up her own shop, where she can serve her customers and work more comfortably. Then her business will have better profitability that would guarantee her improved economic stability and allow her to enjoy her old age in peace alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted items at wholesale (shirts, blouses, jeans, shoes, high heels, accessories, jackets, handbags, and others)

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 28 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the region of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has six children, with four of them currently in school. For the past two years, Christopher has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soda and cassava flour. 

To help expand his business, Christopher has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cassava flour, sodas and other items, and will help Christopher to generate greater profits and educate his children. Christopher hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Christopher is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christopher who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava flour, sodas and other items

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 21 years old. He lives in Ramallah. He sells various electronics goods and other household goods. He has been involved in the retail business for many years, and he still needs a lot of improvement.

He is requesting this youth loan of $3,000 from Ryada to purchase more goods, repair the store door, and make decorations so he would be able to increase his stock and improve his income. 

Ahmad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods, repair the store door, and make decorations.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 32 years old and lives in the town of Koboko in the region of Arua in Uganda. He is married and has three children; two of them are currently in school. For the past 22 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his shoe business which sells ladies and men shoes.

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of shoes and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits to take care of his family. Godfrey hopes that, in the future, he will be able to open another branch.



Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.





"

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: María Daniela

texts.es: María,  es madre soltera de un hijo de 9 años de edad, al que ha sacado adelante sola, pues nunca ha contado con el apoyo del padre de su hijo. A sus 31 años de edad, es propietaria de un almacén donde vende ropa, bolsos, bufandas de la India y artesanías que ella misma elabora; trabaja sola todos los días de 10:00 am a 7:00 pm, y es una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica; así logra generar los recursos económicos que le permiten solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Su pujanza, tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido sobrepasar los diferentes obstáculos que le presenta la vida, especialmente aquellos que afectan su estabilidad económica, ya que en algunas ocasiones sus ingresos no alcanzan para sustentar los gastos familiares, sin embargo, esto no la detiene, sino que motivada por el amor a su hijo, sigue luchando incansablemente. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (blusas, pantalones, bolsos, accesorios, bufandas, entre otros), con lo que podrá tener más variedad de surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes y así satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades, logrando aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Es así como María desea seguir luchando para sacar adelante su negocio, pues su principal ilusión es hacerlo crecer y abrirse camino para lograr un posicionamiento en el mercado, que le permita generar mejores recursos económicos y le garantice una estabilidad económica para dar a su hijo un mejor futuro, con una excelente educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother of a 9 year old son, whom she takes care of on her own. She has never counted on the support of her son's father. At 31 years old, she is the owner of a store where she sells clothing, bags, scarves from India, and crafts that she makes herself. She works alone every day from 10:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and it is an activity that she learned from experience; that is how she manages to generate the economic resources that allow her to afford her basic household needs. Maria's strength, tenacity, and perseverance have allowed her to overcome the different obstacles that life presents, especially those that affect her economic stability. Sometimes her income is not enough to keep up with the family expenses, but it does not hold her back. Instead, motivated by her love for her son, she continues struggling tirelessly. Currently she is requesting a loan with which she would like to buy supplies wholesale (blouses, pants, bags, accessories, scarves, among others). With this she could have a wider variety of stock to offer her customers and satisfy their diverse wants and needs, managing to increase her sales and the income she earns for her work. This is how Maria hopes to continue fighting to carry on her business. Her main hope is to make it grow and establish herself enough to get a stand in the market, which would allow her to generate better economic resources and guarantee her economic stability to give her son a better future, with an education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (blouses, pants, bags, accessories, scarves, among others).

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr: Agathe est une femme de 48 ans, veuve et mère de cinq enfants dont l'âge vari entre 25 et 16 ans. Parmi ses enfants, trois vont encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 11 ans ou elle vend la friperie (vêtements pour enfants). son activité fonctionne bien grâce à la bonne qualité de ses marchandises et la clientèle qu'elle a acquise et fidélisée au fil du temps. Elle souhaiterait avoir augmenter son stock de marchandises avec l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes, mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. bénéfice qui réinvesti en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir mais le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agathe is a 48-year-old woman, a widow and mother of five children who are between 25 and 16 years old. Three of her children are still in school. For 11 years she has been a retailer in a market in the area where she sells used clothing (children's clothing). 

Her activity is successful thanks to the good quality of her merchandise and to the customers she has developed and whose loyalty she has secured over time. She would like to increase her stock of goods with the approaching holiday season; this will not only increase her sales, but also her profit margin. 

The profits will be reinvested in part to expand her activity but the rest will allow her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Diego Eider

texts.es:
Diego, un hombre emprendedor de 27 años de edad, se ha desempeñado como carnicero desde hace varios años, el oficio lo aprendió cuando le dieron la oportunidad laboral en una carnicería del barrio donde vivía, allí trabajó por 8 años y adquirió todo el conocimiento y la técnica en cortes que se requieren para desempeñar la labor.
Con el ánimo de generar más ingresos, tomó la iniciativa de comenzar su propia carnicería y legumbrería, para lo cual ya posee el local que está ubicado en un barrio popular de Bello, entre dos tiendas de abarrotes, lo que para él significa una ventaja para su proyecto. Solicita el crédito para comprar un cava, implementos y utensilios requeridos y surtido básico de carnes; así podrá dar inicio a su nueva idea de negocio, con la que espera generar ingresos suficientes que le permitan a futuro, brindar estabilidad a la familia que anhela formar.
Diego es consciente  que para lograr los resultados que espera, debe trabajar con empeño, disciplina y mucho esfuerzo, sólo así logrará posicionar su negocio en el mercado y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diego, an enterprising 27-year- old man, has worked as a butcher for several years. 
He learned this trade when he was given the opportunity to work in a butcher shop in the neighborhood where he lived. 
There he worked for 8 years and acquired all the knowledge and cutting techniques required to perform the work.

In an effort to generate more revenue, he has taken the initiative to start his own vegetable and butcher shop, for which he already owns the space. 
It is located in a popular neighborhood of Bello, between two grocery stores, which to him is an advantage for his business. 
He is requesting a loan to buy a cava, tools, required utensils and basic assortment of meat, so that he can kick off his new business venture, with which he expects to generate sufficient income to provide the stability for his family that he yearns for.

Diego is aware that to achieve the expected results, he must work hard, with discipline and effort. Only then can he achieve a position for his business in the market and ensure a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cava, tools, required utensils and a basic assortment of meat.

loans.name: Shoghakat

texts.en: Shoghakat is an experienced farmer from Burastan village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband and son; the latter is employed in the private sector. His salary, however, is not enough to cover the daily expenses of the family. To assist her son in earning a living for the family, Shoghakat is engaged in aviculture and in the cultivation of tomato, apricot, peach, apple, walnut and grapes. With the help of her husband, she sells the agricultural products in the local market which is a very important source of the family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Shoghakat needs a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a pig and to renovate the roof of the barn.
