She and her family highly rely on the goodwill of lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and to renovate the roof of the barn.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 29 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the region of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Johnson has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells sauce pans, plates, cups and flasks.

To help expand his business, Johnson has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more plates, cups, sauce pans, flasks, glasses and trays. It will help Johnson to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Johnson hopes that, in the future, he will be able to open up another shop.

Johnson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Johnson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more plates, cups, sauce pans, flasks, glasses and trays.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with 5 children.  She describes herself as a motivated individual.  She operates a retail fish business and has been involved in this business for 12 years. 

Her business is located in a good  area and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough funding.  She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy additional stocks of fish. 

She hopes to live happily in the future. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.  A previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne est une dame âgée de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont l'age varie entre 25 et 34 ans. L'un de ses  enfants va encore à l'école. Comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 02 ans environ. Elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit augmenter les casiers de boisson afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle surtout avec l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année. Cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille en partie et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a 55-year-old lady; married and mother of four children whose age are between 25 and 34 years old. One of her children still attends school.  For about two years, she has been running a takeaway business in a district of the city. She has a good experience in this field. 
She would like to use this loan to increase the number of crates of drinks in order to meet her customers’ demand especially with the approaching holiday season. This will also increase her revenue and her profit. 

The income generated will enable her, in part, to better meet the needs of the family and the remainder will be reinvested in the business to expand it.

loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 39 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are still in school.

Ethel is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Ethel requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ethel has been in the pig fattening business for one year now and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ethel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Gemma has been in this business for five years now.

Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Grace Gertrudes

texts.en:
Grace Gertrudes is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Grace Gertrudes is 52 years old and three of her children are still in school.

Grace Gertrudes has a general store business in the Philippines. Grace Gertrudes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, hair conditioner, beer, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Grace Gertrudes has been in this business for three years. In the future, Grace Gertrudes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fast food cart and ingredients in bulk (breads, lunch meat, sauces, soda, etc.)

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passerby individuals. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 15,000 KES, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, paraffin and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, paraffin and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en: Ashkhen is an experienced farmer from Geghakert village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, two sons (18 and 15 years old), parents-in-law and brother-in-law. To take care of the family's needs, Ashkhen and her family members are extensively engaged in aviculture and in the cultivation of onion, greens and strawberries. They sell the agricultural products in the local market which is the main source of income for the family. In order to continue developing her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Ashkhen needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of 2,500 USD to purchase cellophane for greenhouse construction, to buy tomato and potato seeds, to purchase fertilizes, and to pay for harvesting services. Ashkhen and her family members highly rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane for greenhouse construction, to buy tomato and potato seeds, to purchase fertilizes, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora de 25 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora e inteligente, tiene la iniciativa de criar gallinas criollas a pesar de vivir en la zona urbana. Además, quiere instalar su granja de pollos de engorde. Actualmente Dora vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 6 y 8 años. Además, pasa mucho tiempo con su hermana en el cantón, donde piensa poner su granja. Sus dos hijas estudian, pero actualmente ya salieron del periodo estudiantil, esperando hasta el próximo año para continuar.

Dora tiene mucha experiencia en la crianza de aves, ya que tiene 2 años de trabajar con pollos de engorde y gallinas criollas, es así como se gana la vida y además su compañero de vida tiene ingresos que ayudan a la subsistencia de la familia. 
  
El dinero de este préstamo, será invertido en la construcción de un módulo da aves, para poner pollo de engorde, donde utilizara materiales como: tela ciclón, postes de madera, cemento y arena.

Su sueño es tener una granja de pollos muy extensa, ya que desde que se dedica al rubro, le ha gustado mucho.
texts.en:
Dora is 25 years old. She is a very hardworking and intelligent woman. She has the initiative to raise free-range hens despite living in an urban area.

Dora currently lives with her life partner and their 2 daughters ages 6 and 8 years. In addition, she spends a lot of time with her sister in the canton, where she hopes to have her farm. Her two daughters are in school, but now they are on a school break, waiting until next year to continue.

Dora has a lot of experience raising birds, as she has worked for 2 years with fattening chickens and free-range hens. In this way she earns a living, and additionally, her partner has earnings that add to the family's livelihood.

The money from this loan will be invested in the construction of a bird shelter in which to put birds and chickens for fattening, where she will use materials like: cyclone fencing, wood posts, cement, and sand.

Her dream is to have a very extensive bird farm, because since she has worked in this field, she has liked it very much.

loans.use: to build a bird shelter in which to place chickens for fattening, where she will use materials like: cyclone fencing, wood posts, cement and sand.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg (D) Group

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 35-year-old lady currently engaged in selling goats and goat milk. Currently, she has 10 goats. From this activity, she is able to make 3,000 INR per month. She, along with the other nine women from her village, created a Self Help group named "Maa Tarini SHG" and Kalpana is the President of this group. In the picture, the lady standing fourth from the right is Kalpana. The group is made up of members having a purpose to help and support each other in their business activities and in their personnel lives. All the group members are engaged in different activities like selling cow milk,  selling flowers, selling vegetables, etc.

Kalpana lives with her parents-in-law, husband and her two children who are in school. Her husband is a carpenter and sometimes he helps in Kalpana's business activities. Kalpana and her husband both take on all the family's responsibilities. Kalpana has a dream of making a house for her family and educating her children..

Kalpana, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 130,000 INR. Kalpana will use her portion to purchase more goat kids for her business. She is really very thankful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase more goat kids

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a hardworking woman, from her previous loan she managed to buy food items for her shop. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 20,000 as she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Kadziche

texts.en:
Kadziche is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business that will help her grow her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business

loans.name: Albina

texts.en: Albina is from Haytagh village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband. Albina works in the village local school; she is an experienced teacher. However, the salary that she gets is not enough to afford a living. With the help of her husband she is engaged in breeding pigs, cultivating potato, greens (tomatoes during the summer) and strawberries. They sell the agricultural products at the local market, which is a very important source of income for them. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Albina needs to make some investments. A loan of USD $1,500 will enable her to purchase cellophane for greenhouse construction, buy fertilizer and potato seeds, and to make previous credit repayments. Albina and her husband highly rely on the good will of the lenders and appreciate your support in the form of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane for greenhouse construction, buy fertilizer and potato seeds, and make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is a farmer from Araqs village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife, two school age sons (9 and 6 years old) and his mother. To take care of his family's needs, Hovhannes is extensively engaged in agribusiness. He cultivates potato, greens and sells the agricultural products in the local market which is the main source of family's income. Hovhannes's wife and mother assist him greatly in his daily activities related to farming.

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Hovhannes needs to make some investments. A loan of 1,000 USD will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase cellophane for greenhouse construction, fertilizers and cucumber seeds. Hovhannes and his family members rely on the goodwill of lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane for greenhouse construction, fertilizer and cucumber seeds.

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor is an experienced farmer from Metsamor village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife. To take care of his family's daily needs, Grigor is engaged in plant and greens cultivation. He cultivates tomato, cucumber, greens and alfalfa. With the help of his wife, Grigor sells the agricultural products in the local market which is the main source of their income.

He currently needs to make some investments in his agribusiness in order for it to function in a productive and sustainable way. A loan of 1,000 USD will help him greatly by enabling him to purchase tomato and cucumber seeds as well as cellophane for greenhouse construction. He has previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately he wasn't able to pay it back; however, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Grigor was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Grigor and his wife will be thankful to all lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase tomato and cucumber seeds as well as cellophane for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en: Hovhannes is an experienced agronomist from Ptghunq, a village in the region of Armavir. He lives with his wife, his school-age daughter and son (10 and 14 years old, respectively), and his mother. Hovhannes is the main breadwinner of the family. He is engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in breeding pigs and piglets. He sells his agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. His wife and mother help him in daily activities related to farming. As life is getting more expensive with time, and his family's needs are also growing, Hovhannes wants to expand his agribusiness in order to more effectively meet his family's needs. He needs a loan of 3000 U.S. dollars (USD) to purchase four oxen and some forage (alfalfa and combined forage) for cattle. Hovhannes and his family rely heavily on the good will of lenders and will be thankful for their support.

loans.use: to purchase four oxen and some forage (alfalfa and combined forage) for cattle

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a hardworking woman who lives in the Coastal Region. She is married with four children, three in school and one underage. She lives in a rental house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mbodze operates a food making business, making items like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Illary - Chaska Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ILLARY CHASKA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Yative ella es solera, tiene 56 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia es docente de profesión, la socia a la vez se dedica al venta de productos de belleza como cremas, pefumes,colonias,entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende sus productos  a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,familiares entre otros ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar colonias para damas.

La socia que salen en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de zapatos, brindando el servicio de taxi, director de teatro y docentes.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Illary Chaska”, located in Cusco, and Yative is one of the members. She is single, 56 years old, and is a mother of three. She performs various jobs: she is a teacher in a school in Cusco, and she also sells beauty products, like lotions, perfumes, colognes, etc. She has been working in this business for some time now, and things are going well thanks to her daily dedication. She sells these products to clients who place orders from her, among them, friends and relatives. 

Yative wishes to keep on working to continue to support her family. She is requesting this loan to buy perfumes for women. The member in the attached picture at the bottom had informed the group that she would be late that day, and she wasn't able to join the group picture due to her work schedule.

The other members of the group work in different activities, including: selling shoes, taxi driver, theater director and teachers. 
Yative is thankful to those who join her dream through the Kiva platform, and she commits to make the payments according to the dates established.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy windows and doors for his house

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself as a motivated person. She operates a retail business where she offers printing services and photocopying of documents. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. She also earns extra income from her rental houses.

Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to add stock of printing paper and other stationery. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. She repaid her previous loan of 30,000 KES successfully. She will use the anticipated profits from this loan to start another business. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: add stock of printing paper and other stationery

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilya is an experienced farmer from Tsaghkunq, a village in the region of Armavir. She has a large family consisting of her husband, son, daughter-in-law, 11-year-old granddaughter, and 10- and 4-year-old grandsons. Lilya's husband works in government, her daughter-in-law works in the private sector as a cook, and her son has migrated to Russia, where he works as a laborer and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. To assist her family members in earning a living, Lilya breeds piglets and hens and cultivates potatoes and strawberries. She sells her agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Lilya needs a loan of 2000 U.S. dollars (USD) to purchase a steer; buy cellophane for greenhouse construction; purchase potato, tomato, and cucumber seeds; buy fertilizers; and pay for harvesting services. Lilya and her family will be grateful to lenders for their help in providing the amount they need for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a steer; buy cellophane for greenhouse construction; purchase potato, tomato, and cucumber seeds; buy fertilizers; and pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a widowed mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

Rose has operated a grinding machine business at the market for the past six years. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
Хафиза родилась и живет в столице, в городе Душанбе. Ей 35 лет. Она швея и зарабатывает этим на жизнь. Хафиза замужем. Однако ее муж чтобы обеспечивать семью находится на заработках за пределами страны. У Хафизы двое сыновей и одна дочь, которым по 14, 11 и 7 лет. Они являются школьниками. 
Хафиза в 2008 году прошла курсы кройки и шитья, и уже более 5 лет как она занимается собственным швейным делом. Хафиза принимает заказы на шитьё женских национальных одежд у себя дома. Ей помогает муж сестры. Сейчас ей необходима еще одна швейная машинка, чтобы расширить свое дело. Хафиза для этого просит кредит.
texts.en:
Hafiza was born in and lives in the capital city of Dushanbe. She is 35 years old. She is a seamstress and earns a living doing this. Hafiza is married. However, in order to provide for their family, her husband is working abroad. Hafiza has two sons and one daughter, who are 14, 11, and 7 years old. They are all in school.  

In 2008 Hafiza took dress-making courses and for five years already, she has had her own sewing business. Hafiza takes orders for sewing women's national clothing in her home. Her husband's sister helps her. Now she needs another sewing machine in order to expand her business. For this purpose, Hafiza is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Don Rogelio de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado bovino de doble propósito,con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Rogelio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera para poder producir mas y obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Rogelio is 65 years old and lives with his family in his own home. He has been raising cattle for dual purposes for several years. The profit he generates from his sales helps to cover some of his household expenses.

Don Rogelio is requesting a loan in order to buy a dairy cow. This will enable him to produce more and generate more income, which will allow him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Khanum

texts.en: Khanum is an experienced farmer from Apaga village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, two sons, and her mother–in-law. To take care of her family Khanum is extensively engaged in the agricultural business. She cultivates eggplant, greens, melons and alfalfa. With the help of her husband and sons she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Khanum currently wants to expand her agricultural business in order to be able to address the growing needs of her family more effectively. To reach her goal she needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase necessary materials (cellophane and pipes) for greenhouse construction. Khanum and her family members highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain their agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials (cellophane and pipes) for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, 24 years of age, has a grocery shop in Kitengela town and has been in this business for six years. Right now she makes a monthly income of KES 8,000 and it has been profitable. She is married and together with her spouse is blessed with one child.

She will use this loan to buy fruits such as bananas, oranges and mangoes as well as vegetables to sell. She will use the anticipated income to open another grocery business.

This is her first loan term and in the future she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Habma

texts.en:
Habma is 44 years old and married with two children.

Habma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Habma has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

Habma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом Уткирбеком воспитывают 5 детей. Старшая дочь -студентка, остальные -школьники. Супруг работает машинистом в местном предприятии, имеет зарплату, но к сожалению зарплаты не хватает на обеспечение всем необходимым своей семьи, поэтому Назгул решила помочь супругу в этом. У Назгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Назгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 15 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Дети помогают по хозяйству, меняют воду, режут и подготавливают сено для скота. Назгул проводит все необходимые мероприятия по уходу за скотом. Дважды в год прибегают к услугам ветеринара. Для содержания скота у Назгуль имеются все необходимые условия. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коз для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 37 years old, married, and together with her husband Utkirbek, is raising five children. Her eldest daughter is a university student, all the rest are in school. Her husband works as a machine operator in a local business. He has a salary, but unfortunately its not enough to provides for all of their family's needs which is why Nazgul has decided to help her husband with this. Nazgul has a secondary education. 

As the main source of income for her family, Nazgul practices livestock breeding. She started this business 15 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nazgul's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 1 calf and 15 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). Her children help her with this business. They change the animals' water as well as cut and prepare the hay for the livestock. Nazgul performs all of the necessary activities to taking care of livestock. Two times per year, she uses a veterinarian's services. Nazgul has all of the necessary conditions required for housing her livestock. 
 
For the purpose of further developing her business, Nazgul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan to buy goats to increase the size of her herd. Nazgul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en: Rubilyn, age 43, is married and blessed with five children. She manages a clothing business where she sells some used clothes. She has been in this business for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 weekly. Her net profits are usually spent on food allowances and school allowances for their children. Due to a lack of capital in her business, she would like to request a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase used clothes to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so she can improve her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mlimani Group

texts.en:
Mgeni, who is in her late 50s, is a widow with three children, all of whom are grown up.  She has been running two types of businesses for 17 years (selling charcoal and food vending).  She works from 7 am until midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mgeni's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling cooked food and to buy sacks of charcoal.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profits to buy a TV set, a small refrigerator, cupboard, and mattress, started building her house and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy food stock and sacks of charcoal. Some of the charcoal will be used for cooking food and the other portion for selling. Her dream is to finish building her house.

Mgeni will share this loan with her loan group "Mlimani", which has twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food stock and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school and one is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr: Les dix  femmes du groupe Dembagnouman sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Diakoro dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, d’ignames, de chaussure de savon et de farine. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er    cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Assitan (3ème  femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  couscous dans le village de Diakoro. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 170kg de mil chez producteurs  pour  la satisfaction du besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  au marché du village et à la maison à une clientèle mixe. Madame Assitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Dembagnouman group are mostly married in monogamous families. They have an average age of 35 years and on average 6 children each. They all live in the village of Diakoro in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali.) They came to know each other as neighbors, relatives, and through their small businesses in the village. 

The women are in the business of selling cereals, yams, shoes, soaps, and flour. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and they are on their first group loan with the organization.

Assitan (the third woman pictured from left to right in the photo) is a big reseller of couscous in the village of Diakoro. She plans to use her loan to purchase 170kg of millet from producers in order to meet the needs of her customers. She resells her products for cash in the market in the village and from her home to a customer base made up of men and women. Assitan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use to provide for the needs of her children and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy millet to make couscous

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.ru: Зухре 58 лет, замужем, все дети женаты и проживают отдельно. Супруг работает сторожем. Имеет небольшую зарплату. У Зухры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зухра занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зухры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 овцы и небольшой земельный надел на котором она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зухра обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом-на покупку коз для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зухра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zukhra is 58 years old and married. All of her children are married and live separately. Zukhra's husband works as a security guard. He has a small salary. Zukhra has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Zukhra practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 30 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zukhra's hard work, she currently has 3 sheep on her farm as well as a small plot of land on which she grows corn. Her monthly income is 8,500 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Zukhra turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan to buy goats to increase the size of her herd. Zukhra plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Malila Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school and the other is still small.  She has been selling fabrics and bed sheets for two years now.  She works from 4 pm to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Tatu's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy materials to make bed sheets and to buy fabrics.  She sells her products door to door and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to cover household  expenses and to start building her house.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates everyone who supported the Malila group with the loan.  She will use this loan to buy good materials to make up-to-date bedsheets and to increase her stock of fabrics.  Her dream is to finish building her house.

Tatu will share this loan with her loan group "Malila", which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sell and materials to make bed sheets

loans.name: Sam Oeun

texts.en:
Sam Oeun (in the photo), age 30, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. He has been married since 2009 and just has one young son. 

Sam Oeun is a farmer and he gets paid with fees. His wife is a garment worker. He does not have transportation for commuting, so he needs to spend a lot of money for traveling costs. It’s difficult for him to manage income. Hence, he decided to apply for a loan to buy a secondhand motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Guljan

texts.ru: Гулжан 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Трое сыновей женаты и проживают отдельно и самостоятельно, двое из детей проживают с родителями. У Гулжан - средне-специальное образование, она окончила техникум, по специальности -повар. После окончания техникума Гулжан проработала поваром в ресторане. Затем вышла замуж за Анарбека и оставила свою работу, так как начался домашний быт, дети. На сегодня у Гулжан большая семья, ее можно считать примерной матерью и хорошей женой. В данное время дети выросли и Гулжан начала работать библиотекарем в местной школе, имеет небольшой доход, которого не хватает на обеспечение семьи и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гулжан занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 10 овец, а также имеет 1,50 ГА поливной земли, на указанной земле семья Гулжан выращивает фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Guljan is 52 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Three of her sons are married and live separately and self-sufficiently. The other two children live with their parents. Guljan has a secondary specialized education. She graduated from a vocational school with a culinary degree. After graduating from vocational school, Guljan worked as a chef in a restaurant. Then she married her husband Anarbek and left her job, as she began her domestic life and having children. Today, Guljan has a large family; She can be considered an exemplary mother and a good wife. Currently, her children are all grown-up and she has starting working as a librarian in a local school. She has a small salary which is not enough to provide for her family. 

As an additional source of income for her family, Guljan practices livestock breeding. She started this business 30 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Guljan's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 1 calf and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as a 1.5 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans and clover. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Guljan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Guljan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Kwimage Group

texts.en:
Sudi, who is in his early 20s, is single. He has been selling money transfers, like M-Pesa, Tigo Pesa and airtel money for three years now.  He works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sudi's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase all the three types of money transfers. He has successfully paid back all of his loans. He used the profit to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more electronic money transfers. He dreams of building his own house.  

Sudi will share this loan with his loan group "Kwimage", which has a total of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more electronic money transfers.

loans.name: Mikocheni A Group

texts.en:
Alex, who is in his late 20s, is single. He has been running a retail shop where he sells dry food and soft drinks for three years now. He works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Alex's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With his previous loans, all of which has been paid back successfully, Alex bought out-of-stock items in his shop. He is doing great and is happy with the loan. He used the profit to buy his mobile telephone, bought a bed, a mattress and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sugar, beans, rice, maize flour, water, sodas, juice, etc. for his shop and make floor repairs. He dreams of owning a big retail shop.

Alex will share this loan with his loan group "Mikocheni A", which has a total of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, maize flour, water, sodas, juice etc., for his shop and make floor repairs.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesús

texts.es: Orlando es un joven campesino de 23 años de edad, padre de un hijo de 2 años y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Durante su vida productiva obtuvo experiencia laboral, trabajando como aserrador por 4 años, pero con el ánimo de generar recursos de manera independiente decidió retirarse de su empleo y así prestar el servicio para lo cual toma en arriendo una motosierra; de esta manera ha logrado generar los recursos económicos suficientes para solventar las necesidades de su familia. El cliente es un joven trabajador, dinámico y muy responsable, ha logrado sobrepasar diversos desafíos que se presentan especialmente por falta de capital de trabajo; sin embargo, siempre va buscando nuevas alternativas que le ayuden a salir adelante; es por ello que se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el que comprará una motosierra, para poder continuar con su labor y generar un margen de utilidades más alto, ya que no tendrá que gastar dinero pagando el arriendo de la máquina, esto le dará la libertad para hacer todo tipo de trabajos en los diferentes lugares de la región, aumentando sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe. Orlando manifiesta que desea seguir luchando para lograr sus metas, y en un futuro cercano desea adquirir otra motosierra que le permita generar una nueva oportunidad de empleo, mejorando la rentabilidad del negocio, lo que le permitirá garantizar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is a young 23 year old farmer and father to a two year old boy. He lives with his partner in a de facto relationship. During his life he has had four years of work experience working as a sawyer, however as he wanted to gain an income working independently he decided to stand down from that position and offer his services freelance. To do so he has had to rent a chainsaw. This job has seen him earn a decent enough living to meet all of his family's needs. 

Our client is a hardworking young man who is dynamic and very responsible. He has been able to overcome various challenges that have arisen, especially in regards to his lack of working capital. Even so, he is always looking for new alternatives that will help him to get ahead, which is the reason why he has requested a loan to buy a chain saw so that he can continue his work and make a higher profit margin. Since he will not have to waste money paying rent on a machine, it will give him the freedom to do all types of jobs in many different areas in the region, thus increasing his sales and income.

Orlando states that he wants to keep striving to achieve his goals. In the near future he wants to acquire another chainsaw that will allow him to create a new job opportunity and increase the profitability of his business, which will guarantee his family a better sense of well being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (shirts, blouses, shoes, trainers, bags, jackets and other items.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame Astou est une femme âgée de 43 ans qui est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle évolue dans  la commercialisation des céréales et la confection des draps.  Elle a une expérience de plus  de 8ans et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes .Astou sollicite ce montant pour acheter du fil et  du tissu pour confectionner des draps, elle fait aussi la vente de céréales. A l’avenir Astou voudrait diversifier ses activités afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Astou is a 43-year old woman who is married and mother to five children. She has been building up a business selling cereals and making bed sheets, and has more than eight years' experience. She begins her day at eight in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening. She helps her husband to manage the daily outgoings. Astou is requesting this loan so she can buy thread and fabric to make sheets with. She also sells cereals. In the future she would like to diversify her activities so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cereals and make bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Marie est une femme célibataire qui vit dans un qartier de la capital. Elle tient un restaurant depuis trois  ans où elle propose divers plats. Grace à son dynamisme elle s'est faite une clientèle dont elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela, elle sollicite un prêt dans l'otique d'augmenter son stock de nourriture et de boissons. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront d'assurer la pérennité de son entreprise tout en subvenant aux besoins de ses frères.
texts.en: Marie is a single woman who lives in one of the capital's districts. She has been running a restaurant for the past three years, where she serves a variety of dishes. Due to her high energy, she has built up a customer base that she would like to continue to satisfy. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan so that she can increase her stock of food and beverages. The profits made as a result of this loan will allow her to ensure the longevity of her business while meeting the needs of her brothers.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a semi industrial pressure washer and a vacuum cleaner

loans.name: Mame Diarra

texts.fr: La promotrice s’appelle Mame Diarra, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 36 ans,  elle évolue dans le commerce et a une expérience de plus de 7ans dans son activité. Madame Mame Diarra sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 300.000 F CFA pour acheter des accessoires de mercerie ; elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales et les frais de scolarité de  ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. Elle souhaite à l’avenir développer son commerce et élargi sa mercerie ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de sa vie et celle de sa famille.
texts.en: The borrower is called Mame Diarra and she is 36 years old, married and a mother. She has been building up a business and now has seven years' experience. She is requesting a loan of 300,000FCFA so that she can buy haberdashery products. She helps her husband with the household expenses and her children's schooling costs. She begins her day at eight in the morning and finishes at eight in the evening. She would like to develop her business in the future and expand her haberdashery, so that she can increase her income and improve her living conditions as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery products to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself as a motivated person. He operates a retail business where he sells milk, bread, eggs and other products.
 
Moses has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of enough funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of milk, bread, sugar and other items. 

Moses hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully. Moses will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to add stock of milk, bread, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Vruyr

texts.en:
Vruyr is from a Bagravan village in the Shirak region. He lives with his wife, son and daughter. Vruyr is employed in the government sector; he works as an accountant in the village's self-governing body. His daughter also works in the government sector. Their salaries, however, are not enough to cover the needs of the family. 

Vruyr and his family members are also engaged in breeding cattle and other livestock such as pigs and in cultivating wheat, alfalfa, apples and pears. With the help of his son, Vruyr produces agricultural products for the local market, which is a very important source of the family's income. 

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Vruyr needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase some forage supplies for his cattle, to buy fertilizers and to pay for harvesting services. Vruyr and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate your support in collecting the needed amount for the loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some forage supplies for his cattle, to buy fertilizers and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: María Rubiela

texts.es: María, a sus 59 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Durante toda su vida productiva ha trabajado en el campo de la confección, elabora todo tipo de prendas, dependiendo de las solicitudes de sus clientes, trabaja sola todos los días y, de esta manera tiene la oportunidad de apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica de su hogar. Su empuje, dedicación y energía, le han permitido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado, especialmente aquellos ocasionados por la gran competencia que existe en este campo de acción, sin embargo ha logrado fidelizar su clientela prestando un buen servicio y elaborando productos de excelente calidad. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, entre otros), lo que le permitirá ofrecer más variedad de texturas y colores para satisfacer los gustos y requerimientos de su clientela, logrando aumentar las ventas y los ingresos que requiere para aportar con las finanzas del hogar.  Es así como María quiere seguir empleando su tiempo, para fortalecer cada día más su negocio y en un futuro cercano tener la posibilidad de generar oportunidades de empleo a madres cabeza de hogar; así podrá mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida tanto de su familia, como la de otras personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
María, 59, is married and has four children.  All her life she has worked as a seamstress making all types of clothing accoridng to customer requests.  She works every day in order to help her husband with the household economy.  Her drive, dedication and energy have allowed her to overcome the obstacles she has met, especially the ones caused by the great amount of competition in the sector.  Nevertheless, she has been able to attract loyal customers through her good service and excellent product quality.

She is now requesting a loan to buy wholesale supplies (fabrics, threads, buttons, etc.) so she can offer more variety of textures and colors to satisfy customer preferences and requirements.  This will increase her sales and the household income.  

María wants to continue working along these lines to improve her family's well being and quality of life, as well as that of the other people who have an influence on her work.

loans.use: To buy wholesale supplies (fabric, threads, buttons, etc.)

loans.name: Mauricio De Jesús

texts.es: Mauricio, a sus 50 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una marquetería que inició como alternativa para generar recursos económicos para su familia; la actividad la aprendió de manera empírica y, con el paso del tiempo logró perfeccionar su técnica, cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado directo con quien trabaja todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, así puede aprovechar la ventaja que tiene, pues no posee competencia cercana en el sector, por lo que puede atender gran cantidad de clientes. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar insumos y materia prima al por mayor (madera, vidrios, pegante, puntillas, entre otros), con lo que podrá tener material disponible para cumplir con la producción que tiene pendiente, lo que le permitirá tener mejores ventas y mejorar la entrada de recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar. Mauricio, dentro de su humilde personalidad, sueña con poder darle continuidad a su negocio, acreditarlo y en un futuro poder adquirir un local mucho más amplio, en el que pueda generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y así mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia, como la de otras personas que influyan en esta ardua labor.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 50, has his own marquetry business which he began with economic resources from his family.  He learned the skill on his own and over time has been able to perfect his technique.  He has one direct employee and works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. to take advantage of his situation, since he has no nearby competition in the sector and has many customers.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies and raw materials wholesale (wood, glass, glue, nails, etc.) so he will have enough inventory on hand to meet pending production requirements.  This will allow him to increase sales and improve income to take care of basic household needs.

Mauricio, who is a humble person, dreams about continuing his business, investing capital and in the future having a much larger workspace.  That would generate more opportunities for employment and improve his family's quality of life as well as that of the other people who participate in this hard work.

loans.use: To buy supplies and raw materials wholesale (wood, glass, glue, nails, etc.)

loans.name: Edilberto Antonio

texts.es: Edilberto es un campesino de 59 años de edad, que durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a realizar las tareas del campo, aprendidas desde que era un niño, cuando sus padres le enseñaban todo lo referente a la agricultura. Hoy en día, posee cultivos de plátano cuya cosecha recolecta y vende en la plaza de mercado de la región, adicionalmente, alterna el cuidado de sus cultivos, realizando labores como jornalero en diferentes fincas de la zona, lo que le permite complementar los ingresos que recibe para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. El cliente tiene el empuje y la tenacidad que caracterizan los campesinos, cualidades que le han permitido salir adelante. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (pesticidas, fungicidas, abonos, fertilizantes, entre otros), con los cuales podrá continuar cuidando sus cultivos y preparar la tierra para la cosecha, logrando así tener una producción mucho más sana que sirva como valor agregado para facilitar la venta del producto en el mercado. Edilberto manifiesta que su avanzada edad no le impide seguir trabajando en las labores que le apasionan, pues hacen parte de sus raíces y se ha convertido en su fuente se ingresos económicos, con los que podrá seguir sustentando las necesidades familiares y en un futuro podrá disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Edilberto, 59, is a farmer who has spent all his life in agriculture which he learned as a child from his parents who taught him everything he needed to know about the activity.  He now has banana plantations and sells his harvested produce at the regional market.  He also works as a hired hand on other farms in the area to earn extra income to cover basic family needs.

This borrower has the drive and tenacity that farmers are known for which have enabled him to prosper.  He is requesting a loan to buy wholesale farm supplies (pesticides, fungicides, fertilizers, etc.) to continue caring for his crops and to prepare the land for harvest time.  In this manner, his production will be healthier and have added value when it comes time to sell the crops at market.  

Edilberto says his age in not an obstacle in his work activity since he loves it.  It is part of his heritage and has become his family's source of income.  In the future he will be able to enjoy a better quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: To buy wholesale farm supplies (pesticides, fungicides, fertilizers, etc.)

loans.name: Diarno

texts.fr: Monsieur DIARNO est un vélo-taxi-man de profession. Il est marié et père de famille. DIARNO habite dans le quartier ou se situe le guichet .Etant à son 1er prêt il sollicite ce dernier pour acheter une moto Djakarta pour en faire du transport. C’est lui qui prend en charges toutes les dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de sa famille. Il quitte sa maison à 8h pour n’y revenir que le soir vers les environs de 20h. A l’avenir il souhaite augmenter son parc de moto Djakarta et  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille/
texts.en: Diarno is a taxi-bike man by trade. He is married and a father, and he lives in the same neighborhood where the branch office lies. He is on his first loan which he wants in order to buy a Djakarta motorbike for transport purposes. It is he who pays for all his family's daily outgoings and schooling costs. He leaves his house at eight in the morning and gets home around eight in the evenings. In the future he would like to expand his fleet of Djakarta motorbikes and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a Djakarta motorbike for transport purposes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, a sus 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de un pequeño hijo, al que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo, Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado como vendedora en una tienda de abarrotes, la misma que hoy en día es de su propiedad, pues el antiguo jefe le brindó la oportunidad de comprarla y pasar de ser empleada a propietaria de su unidad productiva. Allí trabaja sola todos los días, logrando generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Su tenacidad, visión, perseverancia y optimismo le han permitido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con la gran cantidad de competidores que existen en el sector; sin embargo, ha sabido manejar la situación y ha aprovechado la ventaja de que el establecimiento ya cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en el mercado. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (lácteos, galletería, productos de aseo, cervezas, gaseosas, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda que incrementa en esta temporada de navidad que se aproxima, época en la que sus ventas se incrementan notablemente. Elizabeth, con el sueño de ampliar su negocio,  se visualiza en el momento que el establecimiento esté bien posicionado en el mercado y así poder acreditarlo para que crezca y perdure en el tiempo, mejorando la calidad de vida y ofrecer un mejor bienestar y educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 28, is a single mother and she has a little boy who she works hard for.  Throughout her working life she was employed as a salesperson at a grocery store and now she is the owner of that very store.  Her previous boss offered to sell it to her and she accepted the offer.  She works every day and is able to generate enough income to cover basic household needs.  Her drive, vision, perseverence and optimism allow her to overcome the diverse obstacles she meets, especially the many competitors she has in the sector.  But she has known how to manage the situation and has taken advance of the fact that the store is well established in the market.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy wholesale goods (dairy products, baked goods, personal hygiene products, beers, sodas, etc.) so she will have enough supply for the increased demand over the approaching Christmas season, which is when sales increase considerably.  

Elizabeth dreams of expanding her business and seeing it become a well-positioned establishment in the market.  This is so she can invest more money and see it grow and last over time, to improve her son's quality of life and offer him a comfortable lifestyle and a good education.

loans.use: To buy wholesale goods (dairy products, baked goods, personal hygiene products, beers, sodas, etc.)

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Niepos que pertenece a la Provincia de San Miguel, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Tiene una panadería ubicada en su domicilio donde se dedica a la elaboración de pan, bizcochos, tiene una experiencia de cinco años es muy conocida en la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos harina, polvo de hornear, azúcar entre otros para incrementar su producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hortencia, 50, lives in the district of Niepos which belongs to the province of San Miguel.  The local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock-farming.  It is two hours from the city of Cajamarca in the northern mountain range of Peru.

She has a bakery set up in her house where she makes bread and cakes.  She has five years' experience and is very well known in the area.

Hortencia is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN to buy ingredients such as flour, baking powder and sugar to increase production for her customers and generate more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make bread: flour, baking powder and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
María Marleny tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el Caserío de Chilcal Alto una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, la población se dedica a la agricultura de algodón y comercio de animales menores, a dos horas con treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, gallinas, pavos su negocio es engordar los animales y luego ofrecerlos en el mercado de Oyotun, La familia de Anita es unida y se esfuerza, adicionalmente tienen un locutorio donde ofrecen la venta de recargas virtuales a teléfonos móviles, su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas en su caserío, cultiva yuca y maíz.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y una segunda parte para la compra de saldo de recargas y de esta manera abastecer la demanda de este servicio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Marleny is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in the community of Chilcal Alto, a rural area of the district of Oyotun. The residents work growing cotton and in the small animals trade. It is two hours and thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

María works raising and selling poultry such as ducks, chickens and turkeys. Her business is fattening up the animals and later offering them in the market of Oyotun. Anita's family is close and works hard. They also have a call center where they offer virtual refills for cell phone minutes. Her husband does farm work in their community, growing yucca and corn.   

She has asked for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed to fatten up the animals. The second part is to buy cell minutes at a good price and in this way meet the demand of this service, generating more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals and to buy cell phone minutes at a good price.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in the photo) is a silk weaver who lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three children, including one son and two daughters. Her husband is a farmer. 

Weaving is a traditional profession for Sophea and for many of the people who live on the island in the Mekong River.

Sophea has requested a Kiva loan several times. She is now applying for another loan in order to buy a calf to raise. She will earn extra income from selling the beef when the calf is fully grown.

loans.use: To buy a calf to raise.

loans.name: Red Rose Group

texts.en:
ASHA was born in 1971 and is single with four children, one of whom is still in school. She has been a food vendor for seven years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be ASHA's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to increase her food stock. She dreams of opening a hotel.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "Red Rose," which has a total of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her food stock.

loans.name: Elsa Isabel

texts.es:
Elsa Isabel tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en la casa de sus padres en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza cremas, cosméticos y perfumes, sus clientes en la mayoría son mujeres, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos shampoos, accesorrios para cabello y tintes para ofrecer a sus clientes generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa Isabel is 22 years old and lives with her son in her parents' house, in the district of Oyutun, 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Elsa Isabel makes a living selling beauty products such as creams, cosmetics and perfumes. Her customers are mainly women.

She has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy shampoos, hair accessories and hair colours to offer her customers and so generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy hair products.

loans.name: Tatiana Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cebolla al por mayor en el mercado de su distrito, también tiene un negocio ubicado en su domicilio donde ofrece venta de ropa de damas, caballeros y niños, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cebolla para distribuirlo por los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Judith is 21 years old. She lives with her husband in the district of  Buenos Aires, a community characterized by its locust forests. Its residents work in agriculture, commerce and in ranching. It is two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works selling onions wholesale in the market in her district. She also has a business located in her residence where she sells women's, men's and children's clothing. She has asked for a loan of 1 000 nuevos soles to buy onions to distribute in the nearby communities and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy onions to sell.

loans.name: Mereyra

texts.es:
Mereyra tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijas, en el zona rural de Cayaltí, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz y maíz, comercio de los mismos y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores patos, gallinas, cuyes, en su domicilio, los ofrece en el mercado del distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra alimentos balanceados, para una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mereyra is 46 years old and lives with her daughters in the rural area of Cayatí, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. The locals make a living from agriculture, growing and selling sugar cane, rice and corn.

Mereyra  makes a living raising and selling small animals such as ducks, chickens and guinea pigs at her home. She sells them at the district market.

She has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed so she can have an improved product to offer her customers and so make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José Daniel tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña para ofrecerlo a la venta de la empresa Azucarera de la zona, comercio y ganadería, a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia tiene una bodega donde ofrece abarrotes menestras, leche, azúcar, aceite entre otros, José Daniel ofrece servicios de albañilería, es conocido por el servicio que brinda , ha solicitado un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de abarrotes y golosinas para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Daniel is 51 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Lagunas, one hour and forty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. The local people make a living growing sugar cane to sell to the local sugar refinery company.

José Daniel and his family have a small shop where they sell vegetable soup, milk, sugar, oil and other items. He also works as a bricklayer and is well-known for the good service he gives.

He has asked for a loan of 600 nuevos soles to buy groceries and sweets so he can stock his shop and so generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries and sweets to stock his business.

loans.name: Good Work Group

texts.en:
Grace is in her early 30s and is single with two children who are still in school. She has been running several businesses for four years now, including selling charcoal, soft drinks and dry food such as sugar, beans, maize flour, baking flour, salt, sweets, etc.  She works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Grace's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy the out-of-stock items for her business. She has successfully paid back her loan successfully. She used the profits to pay her children's school fees, cover household expenses and make some bricks.  She will use this loan to buy dry foods, drinks and charcoal for resale. She dreams of owning a big shop.

Grace will share this loan with her loan group, "GOOD WORK," whose members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy dry foods, drinks and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gueybi Alexandra

texts.es:
Gueybi Alexandra tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en El Pedregal una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio y cultivo de frutas plátano y mango, venta de chicha de jora una bebida tradicional de la zona norte del Perú, heredada de la las culturas prehispánicas y crianza de animales menores patos y gallinas, es una madre emprendedora que se esfuerza junto a su familia de tener un mejor bienestar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para regar su parcela de plátano y tener una mejor cosecha para ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gueybi Alexandra is 40 years old. She lives with her husband in El Pedregal, a rural area of the Buenos Aires district. Its residents work in agriculture, commerce and ranching. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works growing and selling plantains and mangos and selling chicha de jora, a traditional drink in northern Peru, inherited from the pre-Hispanic cultures. She also raises small animals such as ducks and chickens. She is an enterprising woman who works with her family to have more well being. 

She has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to irrigate a field of plantains and have a better harvest to offer her customers, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to irrigate a field of plantains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en Contando una zona rural de Pucará, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales y comercio e los mismos y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de limpieza y recepción en un reconocido hotel del distrito de Pucará, ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros y de esta manera iniciar su negocio propio generando ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela is 29 years old and lives with her family in Contando, a rural area of Pucará, two hours from the city of Jaén in the northern sierra of Peru. The locals make a living growing and selling fruit and from livestock. The area is known for its hot climate.

Marcela works as a cleaner and receptionist in a well-known hotel in the Pucará district. She has asked for a loan of 800 nuevos soles to buy clothing for men, women and children so she can start her own business and generate extra income for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Islam, who is in his early 20's, is single.  He has been running a barber shop for one year now.  He works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a new barber machine and salon equipment.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit for household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy salon equipment and to paint the salon so it will attract more customers. He dreams of building his own house.  

Islam will share this loan with his loan group "Bega Kwa Bega" which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and to paint the salon so it will attract more customers.

loans.name: Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Sakina, who is in her early 30's, is married with three children, two boys and one girl.  All of them go to school.  She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Sakina's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to replace the old equipment, increase the food stock and repair the business place by making it strong and painting the outside.  The place now looks attractive and can get more customers.  She is really doing fine.  She is grateful for the loan.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy a charcoal stove, chairs, tables and food stock.  She dreams of opening another food stall in a different place.  

Sakina will share this loan with her loan group "Mungu Tubariki" which has a total of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a charcoal stove, chairs, tables and food stock.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo appreciate her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is now requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco nació en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y tiene 41 años de edad, él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, él vive en la ciudad antes mencionada y donde él desarrolla sus actividades económicas entonces él tiene una pequeña cevicheria.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limón, pescado, sal, maíz, camote y otras cosas más. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete apagar puntual sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Marco was born in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 41 years old. He is married and has four children. He lives in the aforementioned city, where he developed his business activities and now has a small ceviche shop. He has already had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for him, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. At this time, he needs a loan to buy supplies such as lemon, fish, salt, corn, sweet potatoes, and other items.
